SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller.client

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.client.Controller
public class Controller extends Object
The Controller class is responsible for managing the game flow and interactions between the model and the view. It handles user inputs, updates the model, and triggers the view to update its display. The Controller class also communicates with the server to perform actions. The Controller class uses a singleton pattern for the ViewSubmissions instance to ensure that there is only one instance of it in the application. This singleton instance is used to communicate with the controller through the TUI or GUI. The Controller class also uses a phase attribute to keep track of the current phase of the game. Different phases of the game include LOGIN, WAIT, CHOOSE_SIDE_STARTING_CARD, CHOOSE_SECRET_OBJECTIVE_CARD, and GAMEFLOW. The Controller class uses a NetworkClient object to handle network communications. The NetworkClient object can be either a ClientRMI object or a ClientSocket object, depending on the type of connection chosen by the user. The Controller class uses a ViewInterface object to handle the display of the game. The ViewInterface object can be either a TUI object or a GUI object, depending on the type of view chosen by the user. The Controller class uses a LittleModel object to store all the required information about the game. The LittleModel object is updated by the Controller class and used by the ViewInterface object to update the display.

  • Field Details

    • phase

      public static Phase phase
      The current phase of the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller()
      Constructs a new Controller object and initializes the game model, phase, and ViewSubmissions instance. It sets the current phase of the game to LOGIN, which prompts the user to input their unique player name. It also sets the singleton ViewSubmissions instance to communicate with the controller through the TUI or GUI.

  • Method Details

    • getPhase

      public static Phase getPhase()
      Returns the current phase of the game.
      Returns:
      The current phase of the game.

    • setPhase

      public static void setPhase(Phase phase)
      Sets the current phase of the game.
      Parameters:
      phase - The phase to set as the current phase.

    • setView

      public void setView(String typeOfView) throws InterruptedException
      Sets the view for the game based on the type of view specified. It initializes a new LittleModel object and sets the view to either TUI or GUI based on the input. If the type of view is GUI, it also starts a new thread to launch the GUI.
      Parameters:
      typeOfView - The type of view to be set. It can be either "TUI" or "GUI".
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if any thread has interrupted the current thread.

    • createInstanceOfConnection

      public void createInstanceOfConnection(String typeOfConnection)
      Creates an instance of the connection for the game based on the type of connection specified. It initializes a new ClientRMI object or ClientSocket object based on the input. If the type of connection is RMI, it also starts a new thread to launch the RMI connection. If the type of connection is Socket, it also starts a new thread to launch the Socket connection.
      Parameters:
      typeOfConnection - The type of connection to be set. It can be either "RMI" or "Socket".

    • setNickname

      public static void setNickname(String nickname)
      Sets the nickname of the player.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player.

    • getNickname

      public String getNickname()
      Returns the nickname of the player.
      Returns:
      nickname

    • askNumberOfPlayer

      public void askNumberOfPlayer()
      Triggers the view to ask the user for the number of players. This method is used to prompt the user to input the number of players that will be participating in the game. The actual input is handled by the view (TUI or GUI).

    • waitLobby

      public void waitLobby()
      Triggers the view to display a waiting message to the user. This method is used to inform the user that they are waiting for other players to join the game lobby. The actual display of the waiting message is handled by the view (TUI or GUI).

    • stopWaiting

      public void stopWaiting()
      Triggers the view to stop displaying the waiting message. This method is used to inform the user that the waiting phase is over and the game is starting. The actual removal of the waiting message is handled by the view (TUI or GUI).

    • refreshUsers

      public void refreshUsers(HashMap<String,Color> playersAndPins)
      Triggers the view to refresh the display of users. This method is used to update the display of users and their associated colors in the game. The actual display update is handled by the view (TUI or GUI).
      Parameters:
      playersAndPins - A HashMap where the keys are the nicknames of the players and the values are their associated colors.

    • cardsOnTable

      public void cardsOnTable(Integer[] resourceCards, Integer[] goldCard, Kingdom resourceCardOnDeck, Kingdom goldCardOnDeck)
      Updates the cards on the table in the game model and triggers the view to display the common table. This method is called when the cards on the table change in the game. It updates the game model with the new cards on the table and then triggers the view to display the common table.
      Parameters:
      resourceCards - An array of integers representing the IDs of the resource cards on the table.
      goldCard - An array of integers representing the IDs of the gold cards on the table.
      resourceCardOnDeck - A Kingdom object representing the resource card on the deck.
      goldCardOnDeck - A Kingdom object representing the gold card on the deck.

    • receiveChatMessage

      public void receiveChatMessage(String sender, String message, boolean broadcast)
      Triggers the view to display a chat message to the user. This method is used to inform the user about a chat message in the game. The actual display of the chat message is handled by the view (TUI or GUI).
      Parameters:
      sender - The nickname of the player who sent the message.
      message - The message sent by the player.
      broadcast - A boolean value indicating whether the message is a broadcast message.

      Parameters:
      startingCardId - The ID of the starting card.

      currentPlayer - The nickname of the current player.
      gameState - The current state of the game.

    • updateAndShowSecretObjectiveCard

      public void updateAndShowSecretObjectiveCard(int indexCard)
      Updates the game model with the secret objective card chosen by the player and triggers the view to display the secret objective card. This method is called when the player chooses a secret objective card in the game. It updates the game model with the chosen secret objective card and then triggers the view to display the secret objective card.
      Parameters:
      indexCard - The index of the secret objective card chosen by the player.

    • updatePlaceCard

      public void updatePlaceCard(String nickname, int id, Point position, boolean side, int turn)
      Updates the game model with the information of a card that has been placed by a player. This method is called when a player successfully places a card on the board. It updates the game model with the information of the placed card, including the player's nickname, the card ID, the position of the card, the side of the card, and the turn.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player who has placed the card.
      id - The id of the card that has been placed.
      position - The position where the card has been placed on the board.
      side - The side of the card chosen by the player. True for one side, false for the other.
      turn - The turn number when the card was placed.

    • updateResources

      public void updateResources(String nickname, HashMap<Sign,Integer> resources)
      Updates the resources of a player in the game model. This method is called when a player's resources change in the game. It updates the game model with the new resources of the player.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player whose resources have been updated.
      resources - A HashMap where the keys are the types of resources (Sign) and the values are the quantities of each resource (Integer).

    • updateScore

      public void updateScore(String nickname, int points)
      Updates the score of a player in the game model. This method is called when a player's score changes in the game. It updates the game model with the new score of the player.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player whose score has been updated.
      points - The new score of the player.

    • updateAndShowCommonTable

      public void updateAndShowCommonTable(Integer newCardId, boolean gold, int onTableOrDeck, Kingdom headDeck)
      Updates the head of the deck and the card on the table in the game model, and triggers the view to display the common table. This method is called when the head of the deck or a card on the table changes in the game. It updates the game model with the new head of the deck and the new card on the table, and then triggers the view to display the common table.
      Parameters:
      newCardId - The id of the new card that has been placed on the table.
      gold - The gold status of the new card. True if it's a gold card, false otherwise.
      onTableOrDeck - The location of the new card. 0 for on the table, 1 for on the deck.
      headDeck - The new head of the deck.

    • updateHand

      public void updateHand(Integer[] hand)
      Updates the hand of a player in the game model. This method is called when a player's hand changes in the game. It updates the game model with the new hand of the player.
      Parameters:
      hand - An array of integers representing the IDs of the cards in the player's hand.

    • updateHiddenHand

      public void updateHiddenHand(String nickname, javafx.util.Pair<Kingdom,Boolean>[] hand)
      Updates the hidden hand of a player in the game model. This method is called when a player's hidden hand changes in the game. It updates the game model with the new hidden hand of the player.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player whose hidden hand has been updated.
      hand - An array of Pair objects, each containing a Kingdom and a Boolean, representing the cards in the player's hidden hand.

    • showIsFirst

      public void showIsFirst(String firstPlayer)

      Parameters:
      firstPlayer - The nickname of the player who is first in the game.

    • login

      public void login(String nickname)
      Logs in the player to the game. This method is used to log in the player to the game by using the connection object. The actual login is handled by the connection object.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player.

      Parameters:
      numberOfPlayers - The number of players.

    • chooseSideStartingCard

      public void chooseSideStartingCard(boolean side)

      Parameters:
      side - The side chosen by the player.

    • chooseSecretObjectiveCard

      public void chooseSecretObjectiveCard(int indexCard)
      Sets the secret objective card for the player in the game. This method is used to set the secret objective card for the player in the game. The actual setting of the card is handled by the connection object.
      Parameters:
      indexCard - The index of the secret objective card chosen by the player.

    • playCard

      public void playCard(int indexHand, Point position, boolean side)
      Plays a card in the game. This method is used to play a card in the game. The actual playing of the card is handled by the connection object.
      Parameters:
      indexHand - The index of the card in the player's hand.
      position - The position where the card will be placed.
      side - The side of the card.

    • drawCard

      public void drawCard(boolean gold, int onTableOrDeck)
      Draws a card in the game. This method is used to draw a card in the game. The actual drawing of the card is handled by the connection object.
      Parameters:
      gold - The gold status of the card.
      onTableOrDeck - The location from where the card is drawn.

    • correctNumberOfPlayers

      public void correctNumberOfPlayers(int numberOfPlayers)
      Notifies the view that the number of players is correct. This method is used to inform the view that the number of players entered by the user is correct.
      Parameters:
      numberOfPlayers - The number of players.

    • wrongPhase

      public void wrongPhase()
      Notifies the view that the game is in the wrong phase. This method is used to inform the view that the game is currently in a phase where the requested action cannot be performed.

    • noTurn

      public void noTurn()
      Notifies the view that it is not the player's turn. This method is used to inform the view that the player cannot perform the requested action because it is not their turn.

    • noName

      public void noName()
      Notifies the view that there is no player with the given name. This method is used to inform the view that the player name entered by the user does not exist in the game.

    • notEnoughResources

      public void notEnoughResources()
      Notifies the view that the player does not have enough resources. This method is used to inform the view that the player cannot perform the requested action because they do not have enough resources.

    • NoName

      public void NoName()
      Notifies the view that the card cannot be placed at the given position. This method is used to inform the view that the player cannot place a card at the requested position on the board.

    • sameName

      public void sameName(String name)
      Notifies the view that the card cannot be placed at the given position. This method is used to inform the view that the player cannot place a card at the requested position on the board.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the player.

    • colorAlreadyTaken

      public void colorAlreadyTaken()
      Notifies the view that the color chosen by the player is already taken. This method is used to inform the view that the color chosen by the player is already taken by another player in the game.

    • cardPositionError

      public void cardPositionError()
      Notifies the view that the card cannot be placed at the given position. This method is used to inform the view that the player cannot place a card at the requested position on the board.

    • closingLobbyError

      public void closingLobbyError()
      Notifies the view that the lobby cannot be closed. This method is used to inform the view that the game lobby cannot be closed because there are still players in the lobby.

    • lobbyComplete

      public void lobbyComplete()
      Notifies the view that the lobby is complete. This method is used to inform the view that the game lobby is complete and the game can start.

    • stopGaming

      public void stopGaming()
      Triggers the view to display the end of the game, since a player has been disconnected.

    • noConnection

      public void noConnection()
      Notifies the view that there is no connection. This method is used to inform the view that the connection to the server has been lost. After 10 seconds, the application will be closed.

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect()
      Triggers the view to handle the disconnection of the user. This method is used to inform the user that they have been disconnected from the game.

    • getConnection

      public NetworkClient getConnection()
      This method returns the NetworkClient object used for communication with the server.
      Returns:
      the NetworkClient object used for communication with the server.

    • setModel

      public void setModel(GameMaster game)
      Sets the model for the game. And triggers the view to display.
      Parameters:
      game - The GameMaster object containing all the information about the game.
